node.title: Queensland mandates PCR tests, but who should pay? D'Ath says the Commonwealth
node.alt: A close-up photograph of gloved hands holding a biohazard bag with a COVID swab inside.
node.description: In a matter of weeks, Queensland will require new arrivals to take a PCR test within 72 hours of entry.Â But it's still not clear who will pay for it. Even less clear is what the changes mean for border residents.
node.content:
["NSW's border commissioner has called for clarity on the Queensland government's looming border changes as the Health Minister again demands the Commonwealth help fund a key plank of the state's reopening plan.", "Unlike other states and territories, Queensland says it will not drop the requirement for a PCR test for new arrivals once the state's double vaccination rate hits 80 per cent.", "On Sunday, Health Minister Yvette D'Ath said that Queensland was in a \"different position\" to New South Wales and Victoria \u2014 states that are recording dozens, if not hundreds, of new cases each day.", "\"They can be more relaxed because they already have the virus throughout their communities, so they're not trying to suppress the virus like we are,\" Ms D'Ath said.", "The Health Minister said cost shouldn't be a consideration when deciding which test to take.", "\"This is something that the Morrison government should seriously turn its mind to,\" Ms\u00a0D'Ath said.", "Other states and territories are encouraging the use of cheaper and faster rapid antigen tests, but Queensland's Acting Chief Health Officer, Peter Aitken, said on Sunday that those tests were only beneficial\u00a0with high cases numbers.", "\"To put it very roughly, rapid antigen tests are about 70 per cent as effective as PCR,\" he said.", "\"The stage we're in, with four active cases, we want to identify every case, not miss 30 per cent so we'll continue to use PCR tests at this stage.\"", "On Sunday, Queensland recorded zero new cases. However, the state's vaccination rates were also lower than southern states.", "Queensland's double-dose vaccination rate is 73.06 per cent,\u00a0while\u00a084.35 per cent of eligible people aged over 16 years have had their first dose.", "", "
Rapid antigen tests are cheaper and faster than PCR tests \u2014 but they're roughly 30 per cent less accurate.(Supplied: TLC Healthcare)
", "
PCR tests add up
", "Queensland's borders are set to open once 80 per cent of eligible Queenslanders aged 16 years and over are fully vaccinated. That's expected to happen in early December.", "Under the state government's roadmap, everyone who crosses the border must have returned a negative PCR test within 72 hours of arrival.\u00a0", "PCR tests are free for people with COVID-19 symptoms, but otherwise they cost around $150 at a private pathology clinic.", "The federal government has already refused Queensland's demands to alter Medicare, accusing the government of \"walking away\" from its responsibilities to pay for its share of the\u00a0tests.", "On Friday, a\u00a0spokesperson for federal Health Minister Greg Hunt reinforced the message.", "\"The National Partnership on COVID-19 Response, which all governments have signed, includes a 50 per cent funding contribution from the Australian government towards COVID-19 testing,\" the spokesperson said.", "\"The Commonwealth funds 100 per cent of Medicare-funded tests and 50 per cent of state-based tests.", "", "
It's still unclear whether border residents will need to follow the PCR test rules.(ABC News: Lucas Hill)
", "
Questions over border rules
", "Just weeks before the borders reopen, confusion remains over what the rules will\u00a0mean for border residents.", "NSW Cross Border commissioner James McTavish said Queensland Health had not informed him of its plans, despite repeated requests for clarity.", "\"We'd like to know in advance of the plans that have been put in place, and we'd like to be able to provide some surety to all people in all border communities,\" he\u00a0said.", "Right now, he said, the rules suggest people who regularly cross into Queensland will need to get a PCR test every 72 hours.", "\"If people are having to be tested every 72 hours, it will impact on their capacity to go to work, do essential volunteering, provide care, access medical care and the like,\" Mr McTavish said.", "However, a\u00a0spokesperson for Queensland Health told the ABC on Friday that a border zone will be established for local residents to\u00a0ensure they can access Queensland for essential purposes without having to take a test, whether they're vaccinated or not.", "\"There may be less testing requirements for fully vaccinated people entering the border zone or entering Queensland from the border zone for non-essential reasons,\" the spokesperson said in a statement.", "Mr McTavish said he had not been\u00a0advised of that plan.", "\"I've not been made aware of those changes or that advice at all,\" he added. \"It'd be nice to get that in an email.\""]
